result.title: KGSIR assessing the skill of climate emulators
result.description: D4.12 (M36 ETH, IPSL-CNRS, UNIVLEEDS): KGSIR assessing the skill of climate emulators having participated in the intercomparison and how they should be used. This will examine the credibility of these tools and their limitations, which depends on the timescale, scenario and variable to inform scientists on how to use these emulators and inform policy makers where to trust their results (Task 4.3.2).

result.title: KGSIR on knowledge gained in understanding of climate sensitivity and its role in projections

result.title: KGSIR on carbon budget estimates updates with the latest insights on forcing, variability and feedbacks
result.description: D5.3 (M48, IMPERIAL, CLIMATE ANALYTICS, UNIVLEEDS, CNRS): KGSIR on carbon budget estimates updates with the latest insights on forcing, variability and feedbacks, showing clearly how different uncertainties and short-lived climate forcer pathways affect budgets. Timed to meet IPCC AR6 WGI literature cut-off date and feed into Chapter 5 (Global carbon and other biogeochemical cycles and feedbacks). (Task 5.1.3 and 4.3.1).

result.title: Short report on main outcomes and participating organisations of the workshop on understanding of rapid adjustment processes
result.description: D1.5 (M36, UNIVLEEDS, ULEI, CICERO): Short report on main outcomes of the workshop on understanding rapid adjustment processes: participating organisations: representatives from the H2020 FORCES project, ECMWF CAMS aerosol and radiative forcing projects, and 1-2 non-EU key laboratories. Participants of this two day workshop will include 7 CONSTRAIN scientists and 2 international participants (for whom costs will be covered by the programme) and up to 9 other participants (who will be expected to cover their own travel, accommodation and subsistence costs) (Tasks 1.2.1, 1.2.2 and 1.2.3).

result.title: KGSIR on improved characterisation and understanding of the ERF concept.
result.description: D1.1 (M9, CICERO, UNIVLEEDS, MET OFFICE): KGSIR on improved characterisation and understanding of the ERF concept. This will be based on peer-reviewed publications to be assessed by IPCC AR6 on characterisation of model diversity of ERF due to CO2, on efficacy of climate drivers, and on time evolution of ERF (Task 1.1.1, 1.1.2, 1.1.3 and 1.1.4).

result.title: KGSIR outlining the CONSTRAIN journal publications used by IPCC AR6 and the overall contribution to IPCC AR6

result.title: End-of-Project KGSIR on the role of the ocean in setting the transient climate sensitivity
result.description: D3.3 (M48, METEO-FRANCE, MPG): End-of-Project KGSIR on the role of the ocean in setting the transient climate sensitivity to cumulative emissions, including the relative role of variations in SST patterns, the changes in ocean heat and carbon uptake (Tasks 3.1.2, 3.1.3, 3.2.2 and 3.2.3)
